newsitem.title: USA: Freedom Securities completes buyout from Hancock.
newsitem.headline: Freedom Securities completes buyout from Hancock.

text.p: Freedom Securities said it has completed its buyout from parent company John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Co for $180 million, Chief Executive John Goldsmith said.
"We completed our deal," Goldsmith told Reuters in a telephone interview. "We're going to continue to run the business as we've run it."
John Hancock will continue to hold a five percent stake in the company, Goldsmith said.

Freedom Securities is composed of two regional brokerages, Boston-based Tucker Anthony Inc and Sutro and Co Inc, based in San Francisco, and Freedom Capital Inc, the money management arm of the two companies.

Boston buyout specialist Thomas Lee and Philadelphia-based SCP Partners provided about $50 million in financing towards the deal and about 350 employees invested $25 million, Goldsmith said. The rest of the financing was provided by banks led by BankBoston Corp, he added.
